Title: Harry and Tonto
Cast: Art Carney, René Enríquez, Herbert Berghof, Michael McCleery, Avon Long, Rashel Novikoff, Philip Bruns, Cliff De Young, Josh Mostel, Dolly Jonah, Sybil Bowan, Joe Madden, Bette Howard, Patricia Fay, Muriel Beerman
Plot: When his apartment building is torn down, a retired lifelong New Yorker goes on a cross country odyssey with his beloved cat Tonto. Harry is a retired teacher in his 70s living in the Upper West Side of New York City where his late wife and he raised his children--where he's lived all his life. When the building he lives in is torn down to make way for a parking garage, Harry and his beloved cat Tonto begin a journey across the United States, visiting his children, seeing a world he never seemed to have the time to see before, making new friends, and saying goodbye to old friends. Written by Gary Dickerson <slug@mail.utexas.edu>
Keywords: cat, friend, odyssey, teacher, old flame
Location: Hollywood Walk of Fame, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Art Carney, Ellen Burstyn, René Enríquez
Description: Directed by Paul Mazursky.  With Art Carney, Ellen Burstyn, René Enríquez, Herbert Berghof. When his apartment building is torn down, a retired lifelong New Yorker goes on a cross country odyssey with his beloved cat Tonto.
